intro: Borbonia graminifolia, commonly known as the slender borbonia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Borbonia graminifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
